title: Australian islands, a perfect holiday destination for touristsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Australian islands, a perfect holiday destination for tourists Published  
If you are planning for a vacation in Australia, don’t miss out on the unique islands the continent has on offer. The world’s largest island and smallest continent, Australia has many spectacular islands of its own, including the island state of Tasmania. These islands range from tropical and reef islands including coral atolls, to wild natural islands with huge wilderness areas featuring rare birdlife or rock formations.
 
 
There are sand islands and others covered in rainforest. Many are fringed by spectacular beaches and on some, you’ll find rare species of flora and fauna. Head to these islands to experience spectacular natural beauty, amazing and unique animal, bird and marine life, as well as some sensational gourmet experiences.
Tourists can stay in a luxury tented camp on Wilson Island, near Heron Island in Queensland and escape from the world in their own private paradise. If you’re lucky you’ll see green and loggerhead turtles laying their eggs or baby hatchlings emerging from their nests.Discover the wildlife haven of Kangaroo Island where wallabies, goannas, echidnas, koalas, sea lions, fur seals and a species of kangaroo unique to the island abound. It’s often described as Australia’s own Galapagos Island.
